Community Hub
Fractured Space
Fractured Space is team-based space combat fought in gigantic capital ships. With the intensity of a shooter and the big-picture-thinking of a strategy game, Fractured Space is at the forefront of an exciting new frontier for the genre.
User reviews: Mostly Positive (2,861 reviews) - 73% of the 2,861 user reviews for this game are positive.
Release Date: Nov 20, 2014

Title: Fractured Space
Genre: Action , Indie , Strategy , Early Access
Developer: Edge Case Games Ltd.
Publisher: Edge Case Games Ltd.
Release Date: Nov 20, 2014

Visit the website View update history Read related news View discussions Find Community Groups
Share Embed  

Early Access Game

Get instant access and start playing; get involved with this game as it develops.

Note: This Early Access game is not complete and may or may not change further. If you are not excited to play this game in its current state, then you should wait to see if the game progresses further in development. Learn more

What the developers have to say:

Why Early Access?

“We’ve been running playtests of Fractured Space with a small section of our community since the earliest playable build of the game, and have been gathering feedback and comments ever since. Early Access was the next logical step.

Fractured Space is an ever-growing, ever-evolving space combat game and we want the community at the very heart of the experience. Early Access is the perfect vehicle for this; we want you on board from the word go, and want to give you the power to help shape the continuing development of the game.

We're trying to innovate. We know we don't have all of the answers, however, or even all of the questions, but - having previously worked on Strike Suit Zero - if there is anything the last few years have taught us, it's that there is a depth of knowledge understanding and innovation in the space combat community that we really need to tap into. You are a big part of creating the best capital ship multiplayer game ever created.”

Approximately how long will this game be in Early Access?

“We originally planned to move into full release at the end of 2015, however we have since expanded our scope and as such we're aiming to transition Fractured Space from Early Access to a Free to Play model in 2016. More on this below.”

How is the full version planned to differ from the Early Access version?

“Naturally, during Early Access, we will continue to develop the game. Much of this time will be spent adding the features we have already planned, which includes - but is not limited to - new ships, expanded tech trees, new weapons, evolving the in-game levelling system, expanding on crew, additional ways to play, polishing the main game mode and generally taking the game from its Early Access incarnation toward the game we've always envisaged.

Here is a sample of what has already been done to the game:
November 2014
  • Launched on Early Access

December 2014
  • Map rework (gas station, levelling up system, Jump routes)
  • Added Loadouts for some ships for players to test
  • Balance and bug fixes

January 2015
  • Frame rate optimisation (on-going effort)
  • Added 2 new ships (Enforcer and Protector)
  • Added 4 ship skins (Ghost, Collossus, Watchman, Disruptor)
  • Balance and bug fixes

February 2015
  • New UI
  • Added 2 new ships (Brawler and Equalizer)
  • Added Crew gameplay
  • Balance and bug fixes

April 2015
  • New system for the small crafts and Point Defense
  • Added 2 new ships (Reaper and Destroyer)
  • New skins
  • Balance and bug fixes

May 2015
  • New type of ship added: Carriers
  • Added 2 new ships (Paragon and Infiltrator)
  • Added 11 new Crew
  • Balance and bug fixes

June 2015
  • Added 2 new ships (Leviathan and Ranger)
  • Added Free Weekend rewards (3 skins and the Revenant ship)
  • Extended players ranks from to 10 to 50
  • Balance and bug fixes

July 2015
  • Added absent player detection
  • Balance and bug fixes

August 2015
  • Added 2 new ships (Pioneer and Venturer)
  • Initial introduction of matchmaking
  • In-game store added
  • Balance and bug fixes

September 2015
  • Added 2 new ships (Sentinel and Raven)
  • Takedown system introduced
  • Further matchmaking functionality
  • Balance and bug fixes

October 2015
  • Added 2 new ships (Overseer and Displacer)
  • New game mode - Frontline
  • Overhaul of Crew Selection system
  • Finalized existing ship names
  • Improved visual effects


Our development roadmap is permanently visible on Trello so you can be one-step ahead in terms on knowing what we're working on.”

What is the current state of the Early Access version?

“ In the current build of the game, you can look forward to:

  • 22 unique capital ships across three different manufacturers, each one of them with its own playstyle and more being added with each update.
  • 21 officers to select and build your perfect crew and lead your ship to victory.
  • Weapon variants to unlock and own for your ships and allow you to alter the way your ships play.

Two game modes
Conquest . Our primary game mode in which teams fight for domination of multiple sectors with the aim of capturing the opposing team's home base. This mode is fought on a single map containing 5 sectors of space that ships can warp between. Sectors have forward bases to occupy, mining facilities to capture among asteroids that provide hardcover.

Frontline . Fast paced action with all players assigned any of the ships available in the game at random. This is a streamlined version of the core game focussed on territorial control and team fights.”

Will the game be priced differently during and after Early Access?

“Fractured Space will transition to a Free to Play model upon release. We've ensured that our Founders Tiers, which can be purchased now on Steam, are loaded with content, offering great value and exclusive items to our players before the official release of the game.”

How are you planning on involving the Community in your development process?

“We're throwing open the doors to the Edge Case studio, adopting an Open Development ethic in bringing the game to life. To complement this, we'll be listening very carefully to comments from our community every step of the way. After every update to the game we'll adapt the game based on the collective thoughts of our community in parallel to the design vision for the game.

Our development roadmap is open to all on our Trello board, so you can not only see what is next on our list of priorities but influence where the development team are focused.

If you want to talk through ideas for next steps, ask questions regarding design choices or simply hang out with the team and other members of the Fractured Space community join us every Thursday evening between 19:00 and 21:00 UTC on our Twitch channel. We're also on every social network you'd expect and are committed to involving you in conversation and the decision process for the game, so if you have feedback we're keen to hear it.”

Recent updates View all (56)

November 3

November Patch - 03 Nov 2015

General

Removed the Halloween Moon

Ships

Brawler

Brawler locational damage was not parented, causing issues such as unbreakable armor and other communication problems. Each of the armor parts have now been parented to their correct locational damage to fix the armor issues.

Colossus

Colossus was taking damage but had no armor breaks. This was caused by the loss of parenting of the armor shell and the locational damage scene node. This has been corrected to fix the armor issues.

Ranger

The bottom armor of the Ranger has now been parented fixing armor issues.

We have a brief server maintenance period occurring now.

Downtime should be less than 15 minutes. Apologies for any inconvenience.

About This Game



This is the next generation of space-based tactical warfare. Brought to life in the stunning Unreal Engine 4, giants of interstellar conflict fight in spectacular close quarter battles for dominance. The size of your vessel is matched only by the tremendous firepower it can call on and the fierce opposition you will face. No battle is won cheaply and your fleet must work as one for greater glory.



Pick a manufacturer, choose a class and customize your weapon loadouts. Through experience you gain the right to command more ships while earning credits to add them to your fleet. Tailor your craft to your combat preferences with countless crew and weapon loadout options then take on your specialized role when your interstellar juggernaut warps into battle.



You captain a vessel of unmatched combat authority choosing from an ever increasing number of specialised galactic warships. A game with considerable depth of strategy you must first know your own capabilities and that of your fleet before taking the fight to the enemy. Experience will expand your ability to choose which small victories to chase and how to then leverage them. Mastery of a single ship is your first step, dominance in the war for space coming as your knowledge increases.


The composition of your fleet is vital to your success. Battles may be fought with firepower but they are won with wits. Your fleet of 5 will face an equally prepared, equally skilled, equally ambitious opponent in a ceaselessly transforming fight for control. Your plans will evolve, tactics will shift but as a team you will emerge triumphant. Your individual prowess may be significant but it insignificant next to well organised communication, support and teamwork.



Join us as we throw open our doors on development of a groundbreaking space combat experience. The discussion on strategy is endless; share your war stories, learn from others and become a part of the Fractured Space universe.

Fractured Space is team-based space combat fought in gigantic capital ships.



"...the final product may well be one of the best space combat games ever made" - PCGamesN

Each multiplayer match offers intense team battles combining deadly individual fights with larger team strategy. Use your ship's unique abilities and weapons to exploit enemy weakness and control the map by working with your team to obliterate opponents.

With the intensity of a shooter and the big-picture-thinking of a strategy game, Fractured Space is at the forefront of an exciting new frontier for the genre.

As an Early Access title, Fractured Space is still very much under development. The game will evolve over time, and as a founder you’ll see improvements and additions to the game as they happen.

We’re keen to bring you along every step of the way. We've shifted our mentality as a studio in order to reflect this, adopting an Open Development ethic. We're throwing open the doors to the studio, with regular updates from the team, sharing assets at varying degrees of completion, and even keeping you in the loop with our sprint plans.

For the latest ship concepts, developer logs and other news check out our official website .

We are also regularly updating our design Roadmap on Trello where you can vote on your most wanted features

If you want to talk through ideas for next steps, ask questions regarding design choices or simply hang out with the team and other members of the Fractured Space community join us every Thursday evening between 19:00 and 21:00 UTC on Twitch .

Fractured Space servers are located on both East and West coast of US, as well as in London. The game is designed in such a way that even a geographically remote server should not interfere with your gameplay providing the ping is 250ms or less.

Early Access - Tier system


We have different levels at which you can enter our Early Access. To understand what each option offers, here is a recap:


  • Early Access to the game
(Only available during the April 2015 free weekend)


  • Early Access to the game
  • Founder status
  • Forerunner status
  • USR Ghost exclusive Early Access skin


  • Early Access to the game
  • Founder status
  • Harbinger status
  • USR Ghost exclusive Early Access skin
  • USR Disruptor exclusive Early Access skin
  • USR Watchman exclusive Early Access skin
  • Legendary skin "Goliath" for USR Colossus
  • 1,000 Platinum for use in game store


  • Early Access to the game
  • Founder status
  • Vanguard status
  • Premium Ship - The Phantom (Ghost)
  • - Immediate access to the Ghost ship-type
  • - Unique skin and pre-selected loadout
  • - Ship includes 10% XP/Credit boost
  • Legendary skin "Goliath" for USR Colossus
  • Legendary skin "Artemis" for Zarek Hunter
  • "Type G" skins for Ghost, Watchman, Brawler, Disruptor and Destroyer
  • "Europa" skins for Hunter, Enforcer, Infiltrator, Paragon and Raider
  • "Titan Pro" skins for Protector, Equalizer and Reaper
  • Vanguard presence bonus
  • - 5% XP/Credit boost applied to all team mates
  • 2,000 Platinum for use in game store

Each pack also contains the contents of the pack tiers below.

System Requirements

    Minimum:
    • OS: (64 bit only at present) Windows 7 SP1 (must have KB 2670838 installed) / Windows 8 / Windows 8.1
    • Processor: 2.3+ GHz
    • Memory: 4 GB RAM
    • Graphics: DX11 with Feature Level 11, SM5
    • DirectX: Version 11
    • Hard Drive: 2 GB available space
    • Additional Notes: Supported chipsets: NVIDIA 470 GTX, AMD HD6850 or greater. Laptop versions of these chipsets may not be supported. Updates to your video and sound card drivers may be required. We'll be constantly updating the game to lower the required specs, so bear with us if your machine is struggling.
    Recommended:
    • OS: (64 bit only at present) Windows 7 SP1/Windows 8 / Windows 8.1
    • Processor: 3.40 GHz
    • Memory: 8 GB RAM
    • Graphics: DX11 with Feature Level 11, SM5
    • DirectX: Version 11
    • Hard Drive: 2 GB available space
    • Additional Notes: Supported chipsets: NVIDIA 470 GTX, AMD HD6850 or greater. Laptop versions of these chipsets may not be supported. Updates to your video and sound card drivers may be required. We'll be constantly updating the game to lower the required specs, so bear with us if your machine is struggling.

KHobbits

Recommended
107.3 hrs on record
Posted: October 15
Early Access Review
Fractured space has been a very enjoyable game so far.

The game is still in alpha, and under constant development. In the last couple of months the developers have released an additional 5 ships, all with unique abilities and gameplay styles. Expanding on an already impressive collection of ships.

With over 20 ships you can choose a gameplay style to suit your character, mood, and opposing team, for example:

  • Play as a sniper, with a long range gun, picking off enemies half way across the map, while scared someone is going to jump on you from behind.
  • Play as a corvette, a ship with the ability to heal allies, and act as a floating shield. What it lacks in damage output, it makes up in team cooperation and tactics.
  • Play as an infiltrator, the ability to fly across the map invisible, plant multiple explosive drones onto the hull of your enemy, before triggering a massive explosion.
  • Play as a hunter, a nimble ship with the ability to detect invisible enemies, the ability to teleport across distances to capture objectives, and employ evasive tactics to win dog fights.
  • Play as a reaper, an attack craft with the unique combination of weapons that allow you to damage armour, and deal heavy damage. Limited angle of fire, but equipped with a short term shield which can assist when flanked.
  • Play as a brawler, a close range attack craft that can deal impressive damage when up close, and the ability to 'harpoon' enemies and reel them in close.
  • Play as a raven, a small ship with an impressive attack beam, which can only be fired after stealing energy from other ships.

If they don't sound like fun, then you can play as some of the more traditional ships like the flagship, destroyer, carrier, or leviathan, variations on the battle cruiser class ship, each with its own pros and cons.

The gameplay is heavily team and objective based. While a lot of games are played just using the in game communication, the real fun starts once you communicate with your team mates using voice. While the game lacks a voice system at the moment, the developers provide a teamspeak server, and a number of clans run their own.

That said, there are a number of issues with the game. Since the developers are constantly adding new features, and ships, the game is a constant state of needing rebalancing. While this is an ongoing process, there are some weeks where you find some ships are over powered, or your favourite strategy has become unviable. In the past few months, we have seen the carrier ship flop between being overpowered, and underpowered as the dev's fail to get the balance just right. This is more than acceptable throughout the alpha and beta stages of any game. Some of the other bugs that have shown up throughout the alpha have been worse, but as it stands, the game is massively playable, and I've put in a large number of hours, trying out new strategies and the gameplay mutates.
Read More

Early Access Review
If this is your cup of tea, it is great.
Slow tactical combat, map-wide strategy and stunning ships.
This game is not just about fighting, capture points, flank your enemies, counter their weaknesses, starve them of upgrades. The strategy part really is there.
Please take your time to learn the game if you try it before you even think about writing a negative review.
Most of those are caused by a lack of knowledge/understanding of the game.

Right now I play this game whenever I can, that's why this review is lackluster.
I just honestly felt this game deservers better than "Mostly Positive".
